Certainly! Here is how to continue from "Can you suggest any criteria":

Can you suggest any criteria for selection, and any best practices for assessing the quality and relevance of the studies?"

* After the relevant studies have been selected, the next step is to summarize the findings and conclusions of the studies. The language model can assist in this step by suggesting appropriate methods for summarization and by providing guidance on how to effectively synthesize the results of the studies.

Sample prompt: "I have selected the relevant studies for my literature review on the impacts of climate change on biodiversity, and I need to summarize the findings and conclusions of the studies. Can you suggest any methods or approaches for summarization, and any best practices for synthesizing the results of the studies?"

* The final step in conducting a literature review is to compare and contrast the findings of the studies, and to assess the strengths and limitations of the research. The language model can assist in this step by suggesting strategies for comparison and by providing guidance on how to evaluate the quality and reliability of the research.

Sample prompt: "I have summarized the findings of the studies for my literature review on the impacts of climate change on biodiversity, and I need to compare and contrast the findings and assess the strengths and limitations of the research. Can you suggest any strategies for comparison and evaluation, and any best practices for assessing the quality and reliability of the research?"
